dialogues.text: That's consistent with what we saw.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: How bad is it, Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've corrected the intercept range, but we've got a problem with the intercept velocity.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: How big a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 meters per second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE ON MARK as that news lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone struggles to find a solution. Mark's voice interrupts the silence:

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Commander? 102.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could find something sharp in here and poke a hole in the glove of my EVA suit. I could use the escaping air as a thruster and fly my way to you. Since the source is on my arm, I could direct it pretty easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see you having any control if you did that. You'd be eyeballing the intercept and using a thrust vector you can barely control.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Those are very good points. But.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would get to fly around like Iron Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have left him on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Iron Man, Commander. Iron Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis rubs her face. Thinks. Hmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not the worst idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it actually is. The worst idea. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not his part. But using atmosphere as thrust... (springs into action) Martinez, get Vogel's station up and running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up. What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what happens if we blow the VAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Martinez and Johanssen straighten up. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to open the Vehicular Airlock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would give us a good kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And it might blow the nose of the ship off in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... all the air would leave. And we need air. To not die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll seal the bridge and reactor room. We let everywhere else go vacuo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we'd still have the same problem as Watney. We can't direct the thrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to. The VAL is in the nose. We just point the ship at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the numbers) A breach at the VAL would decelerate us 29 meters per second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which gives us a relative velocity of 13 meters per second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck -- you hearing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we open the airlock doors? There's no way to open them remotely, and if anyone's nearby when it blows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel?

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your suit off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to come back in and make a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say "bomb?" You guys are making a bomb without me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Again, please, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: You're the chemist. Can you make a bomb with what we've got on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. But... I feel obliged to mention that setting off an explosive device on a spacecraft is a terrible, terrible idea.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Can you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ja.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis' voice rings out through the room:

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, be advised: we are going to deliberately breach the VAL to produce thrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS erupts at Mission Control. WHAT DID SHE JUST SAY? 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck -- leave your suit on. Meet Johanssen at Airlock 1. We'll open the outer door. I need you to place the charge on the inner door...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: ...and climb back to Airlock 2 along the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy. On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark RIPS free a jagged edge of metal scrap from what use be the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, I can't let you guys do this. I'm ready to puncture the suit. Let's go with the Iron Man plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, I'm selfish. And I want the memorials back home to be just me. I don't want the rest of you losers in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander... call it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Well, if you want us to call it off, then I guess we have to oh wait... wait a minute. Yep. I'm looking at my shoulder patch and it turns out I'm Commander. So shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel works fast. He pours SUGAR into a strong glass beak Drills a hole in the stopper as Johanssen enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb. In a pure oxygen environment, 16.7 million Joules will be released for every kilogram of sugar used. Eight times more powerful than a stick of dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours LIQUID OXYGEN into the beaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we activate it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel strips electrical wires, threads them into the stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you run this to one of our lighting panels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck (in his spacesuit) enters the Vehicular Airlock as Johanssen is ripping wires out of the lighting panel and threading them into the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you're not still here when this goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the bomb from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Out in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen kisses his face plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell anyone I did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck smiles. Closes the (inner) Airlock door behind her. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the OUTER DOOR opens, revealing SPACE, Beck finishes securing the improvised bomb to the inner door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb is set. On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Johanssen races back to her post, Martinez works quick at his station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I'm running the numbers -- even with optimal VAL blow, we're gonna be off on our angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the new intercept distance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 260 meters. Approximate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too far...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks for a moment. Then she races off the flight de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck climbs out of Airlock 1, and makes his way along the hull of Hermes, using the handholds. We FOLLOW HIM as he traverses the ship, and as he makes his way into Airlock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he finds LEWIS, fully suited up, waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intercept distance is gonna be too far. I'm going untethered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, I can do this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a debate, Beck. I'm not risking another crew member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck sees there's no arguing with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen, time to VAL blow?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANSSEN, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: 15 seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure know how to cut it close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel rushes into the flight deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strap in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tighten the restraints on their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brace for deceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2... 1... Activating Panel 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses ENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE ON THE BOMB as the current hits it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOOM! The EXPLOSION RIPS THE AIRLOCK DOOR TO SHREDS -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Hermes decelerates, Lewis and Beck are SLAMMED up against the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martinez, Vogel, and Johanssen endure the deceleration in their chairs. After four seconds, the ship stabilizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge seal holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Worry about that later... What's our relative velocity?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANSSEN, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: 12 meters per second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Commander Lewis places her feet against th back wall for leverage...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: What's our intercept range?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen stares at the calculations. That can't be right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 312 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark hears the news. Oh SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 312? Great. I'll wave at you guys as I go by.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: I have visual on the MAV --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis sails clear of the ship, controlling her movements her MMU. We SPOT the rotating MAV way off in the distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark -- you're still WAY TOO FAR -- I'm not gonna make it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark hears the news. Steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark unclips his harness. Slams his makeshift knife into suit. WHOOSH -- the air shoots out through the puncture -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're OUTSIDE THE MAV -- as it tumbles away from us -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark Watney soars out of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (having the time of his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have visual on the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHEAD IN THE DISTANCE -- there's Lewis. Mark tries to adj course as they rocket towards each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen -- what's my relative velocity to Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as our SCORE begins to BUILD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE JOHANSSEN -- knuckles white as she types --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5.2 meters per second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE MARTINEZ -- on the edge of his seat --

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Copy. Adjusting course --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE VOGEL -- heart in his throat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3.1 meters per second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE BECK -- watching the two figures rocket towards eac other below --

dialogues.speaker: JOHANSSEN, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Distance to target -- 24 meters -- 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE LEWIS -- as she counter-thrusts, fires her MMU. Try to slow as Mark approaches --

dialogues.speaker: JOHANSSEN, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: 11 meters to target...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE MARK. As he cuts through space. Free as the proverbial bird. The Red Planet silhouetted behind him as leaves it behind, once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the score SWELLS to CRESCENDO, these two astronauts so towards one another, arms outstretched...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANSSEN, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: 6 meters to target...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Lewis float together, holding tight to one anoth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MARK. As he stares at Lewis. The first human he has seen in ages. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have terrible taste in music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone leaps up as Lewis' voice rings out through missi

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ERUPT into CHEERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the CHEERS explode through RUSSIA... 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and NEW YORK as news reports break the story of Mark's rescue on the big screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and CHINA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS guides MARK towards the airlock with her MMU.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Beck, prep the sick bay. We're bringing him to you. Everyone else, meet me in Airlock Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTINEZ, JOHANSSEN, and VOGEL race down from the bridge meet them. They're not in suits -- they have to wait for outer airlock to close. THROUGH THE OBSERVATION WINDOWS: they see Lewis and Mark touch down in the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outer airlock closes -- WHOOSH -- Mark collapses, exhausted. The inner airlock opens. Martinez, Johanssen, and Vogel race into the room, grab Mark. Supporting him. Holding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone fighting back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Mark. Haven't seen you in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What've you been up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You know. Same old, same old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. They help him with his helmet. As they pull it off everyone is suddenly taken aback. Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't showered in a year and a half. Cut me some slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johanssen's eyes are watering. Good lord, he smells bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're asking us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, captain, we may need to put him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. It's never looked more warm and welcoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man sits by himself on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE to reveal it's MARK WATNEY. Basking in the warmth o beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young, fresh-faced recruits in NASA's Astronaut Candi Program are abuzz as Mark enters the room. The students nudge each other -- Look, there he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Mark reaches the lectern at the front, he has full attention of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Astronaut Candidate Program. Pay attention. This could save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's see if I can get some of your questions out of the way up front. Yes, I did, indeed, survive on a deserted planet by farming in my own shit. It was even more disgusting than it sounds. Let's never speak of it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter. Mark lets it subside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question Two: "When you were stranded and alone up there... did you think you were gonna die?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a pause as Mark thinks about it. The rare mom of reflection for our hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. Genuine:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it'll happen to you, too. You should know that going in. It's space. It's filled with chance, circumstance, and bad luck. It doesn't cooperate. At some point, I promise, at some point every single thing is gonna go south on you, and you'll think: this is it. This is how I end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can either accept that... or you can get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets those words land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all it is. You simply begin. Solve one problem. Then the next one, then the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You solve enough problems... and you get to come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark opens his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every hand in the class shoots into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP: "LOVE TRAIN" by The O'Jays carries us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPACECRAFT is readied for launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as soon as Mission Control finishes their pre-flight checks, we will begin launch procedures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNIE MONTROSE stands at her place at the podium. Annie's little older, a little wiser, but can still command a roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ares 5 team will rendezvous with the Hermes approximately 48 minutes after launch. From there, they've got 414 days of space travel ahead of them, arriving at Mars on March 30th. And I'll let the Director of Mars Missions, Vincent Kapoor, brief you on the particulars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINCENT steps to the podium. He's calm. At ease. Much better on television than we've ever seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Their mission is scheduled for 41 Sols. Your briefs detail the research and experiment schedules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the MUSIC CONTINUES THROUGHOUT as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is ABUZZ WITH ACTIVITY as they prepare for launc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINDY PARK takes her place at her STATION. She's moved up the world, now bears the title of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight, CAPCOM. Ready to begin preflight check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN HATCH takes his place as the new FLIGHT DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, CAPCOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ABOVE: In the VIEWING ROOM... TEDDY SANDERS watches th activity from his solitary seat. He has his GREEN FOLDER the ready beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEER trots through JPL grounds... it's still early yet the Jet Propulsion Labs in Pasadena....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But BRUCE NG is awake. And he still looks as exhausted an rumpled as ever. But he's in a good mood. He eats breakfa with his team outside as they watch the news reports detailing the "ARES 5 LAUNCH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and his team laugh, make jokes with each other. One them tosses food to the deer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "People all over the world, join in..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five BEAUTIFUL BLONDE CHILDREN race through the house, wearing NASA t-shirts and jumpsuits -- we get the sense t is the Superbowl for this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX VOGEL grabs his youngest daughters as they race past He scoops them up in his arms. They laugh and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ares 5 astronauts secure themselves into their acceleration chairs. We settle on one astronaut:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEN JIANG. The first Chinese national to go to Mars.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZHU TAO and GUO MING stand at the back of the room, liste with pride as Wen runs through his check. A historic mome for their country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITCH HENDERSON watches his grandson run around the park. get the sense (the forced) retirement is treating him wel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let this train keep on riding, riding on through..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS BECK accepts a bouquet of flowers from a nurse. Set them down next to the others as he checks on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife. BETH JOHANSSEN. Who's holding THEIR NEWBORN BAB GIRL in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck climbs into the hospital bed next to them. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear the TIMER CONTROLLER initiate the COUNTDOWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We settle on the final member of the ARES 5 team:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK MARTINEZ. He grins as he feels that all-too-familiar surge of adrenaline. Here we go again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're MOVING DOWN THE HALLWAY of a quaint house. On the WALLS: vintage albums and posters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna Summer's LAST DANCE on 7"... C'est Chic... A framed top that looks like something Gloria Gaynor wore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mixed in among the glittery paraphernalia:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASA Distinguished Service Medal... The Congressional Medal of Honor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA LEWIS is glued to the television. She doesn't loo up as her husband brings her a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with the crew in this moment. Her husband doesn't t offense. He gives her a loving pat and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "People all over the world, `round the world y'all, join hands..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON THE WHOLE ROOM as the team stares back at us in e anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd erupts into cheers. They reach for one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift up to find... 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth. Blue and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.
